channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Channel crossings: Migrant boats could be turned back
item.description: If used, the tactic would only be used in "very narrow" circumstances in the English Channel, a source says.

item.title: Dylan Rich: England team pay tribute ahead of Poland game
item.description: England's players display a shirt in memory of Dylan Rich, who died after a game in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: The rapper giving away school uniforms to kids on free school meals
item.description: Inspired by Marcus Rashford, Jords has donated over 100 blazers to children on free school meals.

item.title: Sophie Moss death: MP says strangling sentence too lenient
item.description: Campaigners say the sentence given to Sophie Moss's killer sends a "dreadful message".

item.title: Eden Project North: Plans for £125m project submitted
item.description: The planning application is the latest milestone for the 125m project on Morecambe Bay's seafront.

item.title: Beach heart attack survivor reunited with Newquay lifesavers
item.description: David Smith thanks those who saved his life during a surfing lesson in Cornwall last year.

item.title: Covid: More deaths and lower wages in north of England, report reveals
item.description: The pandemic exacerbated inequalities in northern England in health and wealth, a study shows.

item.title: Stamford auction house surprise as Ru ware fetches £320,000
item.description: The "simple-looking" bowl turned out to be a rare Chinese relic, smashing its initial valuation.

item.title: England fan admits abusing players after Euro 2020 loss
item.description: Scott McCluskey posted racist comments about black England players on social media.

item.title: Animal rescue centre told planning bid 'proper whack'
item.description: A council says the response to sanctuary boss Amey James' application shouldn't have been published.

item.title: 'Unbelievable' Only Fools legacy lives on
item.description: John Challis, who played Boycie, said it was "amazing" the show was finding new fans 40 years on.

item.title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
item.description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Rochdale mosques enter Britain in Bloom in eco-friendly drive
item.description: Several Rochdale mosques are entering Britain in Bloom as part of a drive to be more eco-friendly.

item.title: Silsden firefighters help lonely people with community garden
item.description: Crews who built a community garden to bring people together say they want to help their local area.

item.title: Motor neurone disease: Fundraising friends raise thousands for charity
item.description: Phil Rossall and Marcus Green raise money for charity through running and blinking challenges.

item.title: US Open: Emma Raducanu reaches semi-finals by beating Belinda Bencic
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu reaches the US Open semi-finals with a superb straight-set win over Swiss 11th seed Belinda Bencic.

item.title: Manchester City Women 0-1 Real Madrid Femenino: Hosts fail to qualify for Women's Champions League
item.description: Manchester City boss Gareth Taylor targets success in domestic competitions after his side's failure to reach the Women's Champions League group stage.

item.title: Notts on top of County Championship after win over Lancashire
item.description: Notts beat Lancashire by 102 runs at Trent Bridge to go top of Championship Division One with two games to play.

item.title: Eight to miss Premier League games as Brazil invoke ban
item.description: Premier League clubs remain hopeful their players will be released for matches this weekend, after four national associations trigger a Fifa rule to prevent them appearing.
